quote: The best revenge is to improve yourself.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib
explanation: Instead of seeking to harm those who hurt you or holding onto resentment, focus your energy on bettering yourself - your character, your actions, your faith. Self-improvement becomes the most dignified response.

quote: Do for this life as if you live forever, do for the afterlife as if you will die tomorrow.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib
explanation: Live with the perspective of both worlds: plan productively for your earthly life, but act with urgency and sincerity toward the next life. Balance worldly preparation with spiritual readiness.

quote: Never explain yourself to anyone, because the one who likes you would not need it, and the one who dislikes you wouldn’t believe it.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib
explanation: Some people will accept you, some won’t - your inner peace doesn’t depend on convincing everyone. Focus on sincerity, not on defending yourself to those unwilling to understand.

quote: Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
author: Rumi
explanation: The greatest barrier to love (and Divine love) is internal - our fear, past wounds, hidden doubts. The work is inward: uncover and remove those obstacles so love can flow freely.

quote: You are not a drop in the ocean. You are the ocean in a drop.
author: Rumi
explanation: Within you resides vastness - not a tiny part, but the whole in miniature. Recognizing your intrinsic worth and connection to the Divine transforms how you live and respond.

quote: Life is a balance between holding on and letting go.
author: Rumi
explanation: Some things to hold onto (faith, values, purpose), others to release (fear, regret, attachments). Wisdom lies in sensing which is which - so you neither cling to what harms nor abandon what nourishes.

quote: The disease of the heart is worse than the disease of the body.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib
explanation: Physical ailments hurt, but spiritual or moral decay is deeper. Attending to the soul - purifying intentions, aligning values - is more urgent than mere bodily health.

quote: A moment of patience in a moment of anger prevents a thousand moments of regret.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib
explanation: In the heat of anger we often say or do things we regret. A single pause, a bit of restraint, can save countless future sorrows. Patience is the guardrail of wisdom.

quote: Stop acting so small. You are the universe in ecstatic motion.
author: Rumi
explanation: Don’t shrink yourself by limiting belief or fear. You’re more than you think - allow yourself to expand, to reflect the greatness you carry inwardly.

quote: No wealth like education and no poverty like ignorance.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib
explanation: True wealth is knowledge and insight; true poverty is lack of awareness. Invest in yourself, your understanding, your moral compass - they are assets that endure.
